SEARCH
Package com.RPG.Core

Class Entity

java.lang.Object
com.RPG.Core.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Hero, Monster
public abstract class Entity extends Object
A class representing all Entity-types
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ben Demets
Invariants:
Every entity must have a valid name 
isValidName(getName())
Every entity must have a valid amount of hitpoints 
isValidHP(getHP)
an entity can have multiple DamageTypes except if one of those is Normal then it can only have the normal type, and can only have 1 of each, and cannot be empty 
hasValidDamageTypes()
every Item in an anchorpoint of an entity most have this entity as its holder, even the items contained in other items contained in this entity's anchorpoints 
hasValidItems()
An entity must have a valid Strength 
isValidStrength()
an entity musty have a valid capacity 
isValidCapacity()
an entity can not hold more items than its capacity can hold 
canHoldItems()

    • getBaseDamage

      public long getBaseDamage()
      getter for the baseDamage of an entity
      Returns:
      the total amount of base Damage 
      totalDamage = 0
if(this.isIntelligent())
  totalDamage += this.getActiveWeaponDamage + this.getStrength + this.getTotalDamageTypeDamage - 10
else totalDamage += his.getStrength + this.getTotalDamageTypeDamage - 10
result == totalDamage
      Effects:
      If the entity is intelligent we add the Active weapons damage 
      if(this.isIntelligent())

for index = 0; index < item.getAmountOfItems; Index++
  items.add(item.getItemAt(Index))
result == items

    • equip

      @Raw public void equip(AnchorPoint anchorPoint, Item item)
      equips a given item to a given anchorpoint
      Parameters:
      anchorPoint - the anchorpoint we want to equip the item to
      item - the item we want to equip to the anchorpoint
      Preconditions:
      Entity must have anchorpoint 
      hasAnchorPoint()
      item must be valid 
      item.isValidItem
      Entity or item cant be terminated 
      this.isTerminated() || item.isTerminated()
      if item cant be null 
      item != null
      Postconditions:
      Item of anchorpoint is set to given item 
      this.getAnchorPoint(anchorPoint).setItem(item)
      Holder of the item is set to this entity 
      item.setHolder(this)
      Effects:
      if Item is in a backpack unpack it first 
      item.getBackpack().unpack(item)
      if anchorpoint already has an item, unequip it 
      this.unequip(getAnchorPoint(anchorPoint), getAnchorPoint(anchorPoint).getItem());

    • unequip

      @Raw public void unequip(AnchorPoint anchorPoint, Item item)
      unequips an item from an entity
      Parameters:
      anchorPoint - the anchorpoint we want to unequip the item from
      item - the item we want to unequip from the anchorpoint
      Preconditions:
      Entity must have anchorpoint 
      hasAnchorPoint()
      Anchorpoint must contain Item 
      getAnchorPoint(anchorPoint).hasAsItem(item)
      Entity or item cant be terminated 
      this.isTerminated() || item.isTerminated()
      Anchorpoint must ba able to attach item 
      anchorpoint.canAttach(Item)
      Postconditions:
      set item on anchorpoint to null 
      getAnchorPoint(anchorPoint).setItem(null)
      Holder of Item must be set to null 
      item.setHolder(null)

    • isValidName

      @Raw public boolean isValidName(String name)
      Checks whether the given name is a valid name
      Parameters:
      name - The name to be checked
      Returns:
      True if the name is valid, not empty and follows the nameRegex, false otherwise 
      if (name == null) || !name.matches(this.getNameRegex())
  result == false

    • isValidHp

      public boolean isValidHp(long HP)
      Checks whether the Hp of an entity is valid
      Parameters:
      HP - The Hp that needs to be checked
      Returns:
      true if HP is bigger han or equal to zero, is lower than or Equal to its max HP and the Hp is a Prime number 
      result == (this.getHP() >= 0 && this.getHP <= this.getMaxHP() && isPrime(getHP()))
      Effects:
      If the MaxHP is zero it means the maxHp has not been initialised yet, and thus is the HP allowed to be bigger than it to set it 
      if (this.getMaxHP() == 0){result == (this.getHP() >= 0 && isPrime(getHP()))}

    • isHealable

      checks whether an entity can heal
      Returns:

    • areValidDamageTypes

      @Raw public abstract boolean areValidDamageTypes(HashSet<DamageType> damageTypes)
      checks whether the given damagetypes are valid
      Parameters:
      damageTypes - the damagetypes that need to be checked
      Returns:
      true if damageTypes has a length of 1, false otherwise 
      result == (damageTypes.size() == 1)
      Note:
      we are sure the elements are unique because of the used datatype

      Returns:
      if the entity has Valid DamageTypes, false otherwise 
      this.areValidDamageTypes(DamageTypes)

    • hasValidItems

      public boolean hasValidItems()
      checks if all Items in an entity are valid
      Returns:
      true if an item is terminated or does not have this entity as its holder, false otherwise 
      for each anchorpoint in anchorpoints
  for each item in anchorPoint.getAllItems()
      if item.isTerminated() OR item.getHolder() != this
          result == false
result == true

result == false

      Returns:
      true if the entity has the anchorpoint, false otherwise 
      for Index < getAmountOfAnchorPoints(); Index++
  if this.getAnchorpointAt(Index) == anchorpoint

result == false

    • canHoldItems

      public boolean canHoldItems()
      checks if an entity can hold all its items
      Returns:
      true if entity can hold all its items, false otherwise 
      result == this.getTotalWeight() <= this.Capacity

    • hasProperAnchorpoints

      public abstract boolean hasProperAnchorpoints()
      a checker that checks if a hero has all the needed anchorpoints exactly once
      Returns:
      true if an entity has only allowed anchorpoints for that entity, false otherwise

    • canEquip

      @Raw public boolean canEquip(Item item)
      checks if an entity can equip a certain item
      Parameters:
      item - item we want to check for
      Returns:
      true if we can equip Item, false otherwise 
      if (item == null) result == true
result == !(this.getTotalWeight() + item.getTotalWeight() > this.Capacity)
